skill.name: dnanexus-integration
skill.description: DNAnexus cloud genomics platform. Build apps/applets, manage data (upload/download), dxpy Python SDK, run workflows, FASTQ/BAM/VCF, for genomics pipeline development and execution.
skill.summary: DNAnexus cloud genomics platform. Build apps/applets, manage data (upload/download), dxpy Python SDK...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill is documentation and examples without executable code. Examples include external command execution and DNAnexus API usage, which can affect local files and network activity when followed. No obfuscation or credential harvesting is present.

content.value_statement: Genomics workflows on DNAnexus can be hard to structure and run. This skill provides clear steps for apps, data handling, and job execution.
actual_capabilities: Explain how to build and deploy DNAnexus apps and applets
Show dxapp.json configuration for inputs, outputs, and run specs
Provide dxpy patterns for upload, download, and search
Describe job execution, monitoring, and workflow chaining
Outline dependency setup including assets and Docker usage
limitations: Requires a DNAnexus account and project permissions
Assumes dx toolkit and dxpy are installed
Cannot execute or validate DNAnexus jobs without platform access
Does not cover non DNAnexus cloud platforms

use_cases.title: Deploy a pipeline step
use_cases.description: Create an applet with proper inputs, outputs, and runtime settings for a sequencing workflow.

use_cases.title: Organize sequencing data
use_cases.description: Upload and tag FASTQ or BAM files and structure project folders for analysis.

use_cases.title: Orchestrate workflows
use_cases.description: Chain applets into multi step workflows and monitor job states.

prompt_templates.title: Start with dxpy
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to authenticate, upload a FASTQ file, and download results using dxpy.

prompt_templates.title: Create an applet
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a minimal dxapp.json and Python entry point for a quality filter applet.

prompt_templates.title: Run a workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to chain two applets with output references and track job status.

prompt_templates.title: Scale batch jobs
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a dxpy pattern to find all BAM files and launch parallel jobs with tags.

output_examples.input: Give me a checklist to run an applet on new FASTQ data
output: Confirm you can log in and access the target project
Upload FASTQ files into a clear project folder
Run the applet with required inputs and parameters
Monitor job state and review logs for errors
Download outputs and verify expected files

best_practices: Validate inputs and handle errors in dxpy calls
Use clear metadata and tags for searchability
Select instance types that match data size
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API tokens in scripts or configs
Running large jobs without small scale tests

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is platform independent and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: You need DNAnexus access and installed tools. It cannot run jobs without platform credentials.

faq.question: How does it integrate with existing pipelines?
faq.answer: It uses dxpy and dxapp.json to wrap steps and connect them within DNAnexus workflows.

faq.question: Does it collect or transmit my data?
faq.answer: No. It only provides instructions. Data access happens through your DNAnexus account.

faq.question: What should I do if a job fails?
faq.answer: Check job logs, verify inputs are closed, and rerun with adjusted resources or parameters.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic cloud tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on DNAnexus APIs and workflows instead of general purpose cloud storage or compute.
